Detailed Description

Model class to store model data.

The model class is used to read in and store model data that is read in using the assimp import asset library. It contains all the functionality to load in a model of many different file types and store the information in various data structures to be accessed later.

Author:
Cordell Smith
Version:
01
Date:
31/05/2018

Model::Model (  ) 

Constructor.

This is the default constuctor that sets the scale value of the model to 1, initializes the models shader as well as setting the AI of the model to NULL.

Member Function Documentation

void Model::LoadModel ( std::string  filePath  ) 

Loads the model data.

This function loads the model data taking in a relative string file path. The function then uses the assimp import asset library to read the file and with other helper functions, store the data in the correct member variable data structures.

Parameters:
std::string filePath
Returns:
void

void Model::ProcessNode ( aiNode *  node,
const aiScene *  scene 
)

Processes the node of an aiScene.

Assimp reads the loaded file as a scene that contains many nodes. The nodes are stored in a linked list data structure. This function processes the specific node that is being examined.

Parameters:
aiNode* node
const aiScene* scene
Returns:
void

Mesh Model::ProcessMesh ( aiMesh *  mesh,
const aiScene *  scene 
)

Processes the mesh.

For each node that is contained in a scene, if it contains a mesh, then this function processes it. It reads the vertex data in the aiNode object and stores them in the correct member data structures.

Parameters:
aiMesh* mesh
const aiScene* scene
Returns:
void
